mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: Francis H. Pierpont Civil War Telegrams
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Van Winkle, Peter G. to Pierpont, Francis H.
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Van Winkle, Peter G.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Dated Parkesburg Oct 18 1861. Received 11 o'clock 10 min AM to Gov F.H. Peirpoint The troops are here waiting orders. Hill was fighting yesterday this side of the oil wells with some loss. A messenger just from Webbs Mills says the same game is playing in that vicinity 30 or more rebels armed and mounted passed up the south fork of Hughes River yesterday they threaten to Rob the stores and shoot men who have acted as guides for our troops. The Railroad guards at Ellenborro are poorly supplied with ammunition. VanW
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Van Winkle, Peter G.
Parkersburg, (West) Virginia
Wheeling, (West) Virginia
Pierpont, Francis H.
